words.defineEn: to discuss or mention a particular topic or subject, usually through spoken or written communication
words.defineVi: để thảo luận hoặc đề cập đến một chủ đề hoặc chủ đề cụ thể, thường thông qua giao tiếp nói hoặc viết

examples: The teacher placed the books on the desk.
I placed the shiny red apple in the basket.
He placed the puzzle pieces back into the puzzle box.
My computer is placed on the desk in the office.
The bolt clicked into place.
words.defineEn: the part of space where someone or something is or they should be
words.defineVi: một phần của không gian nơi ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó hoặc họ nên được

words.defineEn: in a place that is far away from cities, towns, or anywhere that is occupied by people
words.defineVi: ở một nơi cách xa thành phố, thị trấn hoặc bất cứ nơi nào có người ở

examples: My father had a living in an inner suburb of Leeds which had been going down in the world for decades.
I can't sell suburbs.
Over the weekend, federal agents searched Warner's house in a Nashville suburb.
I'm from the suburbs.
We begin in the American suburbs.
words.defineEn: a residential area outside a city
words.defineVi: một khu dân cư bên ngoài một thành phố

examples: My mother throws that far away.
I've saved almost £100 so far.
The kangaroo can jump very far with its powerful hind legs.
The music was far too loud for my liking.
They went farther north into the mountains.
words.defineEn: to or at a great distance
words.defineVi: đến hoặc ở một khoảng cách lớn

examples: Many migratory birds fly south for the winter and return north in the spring.
The south of the country is known for its beautiful beaches.
The south of the city is more residential, while the north is more commercial.
They were both raised in the South.
Everyone in the gang went south when they learned that the police had discovered their hideout.
words.defineEn: situated in or toward the south
words.defineVi: nằm trong hoặc hướng về phía nam

examples: Our hearts go out to the families of the victims of this terrible tragedy.
They never lost heart, even in the face of adversity.
They pour out their hearts to God.
Please, open your hearts to these poor people.
And now the poor thing is crying his heart out.
words.defineEn: the middle or central part of something
words.defineVi: phần giữa hoặc trung tâm của một cái gì đó

examples: The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
My friends enjoyed smoky beef rib chops at the countryside barbecue.
At a countryside farm festival, attendees line up for a taste of the famous trotter barbecue.
Ruinous new road schemes that desecrate the countryside.
My family and I often travel by car to visit relatives in the countryside.
words.defineEn: the area with farms, fields, and trees, that is outside cities and towns
words.defineVi: khu vực có trang trại, cánh đồng và cây cối, nằm ngoài thành phố và thị trấn

examples: The car holds the corners very well.
A bus appeared around the corner.
She drew a yellow sun on the corner of the paper.
He has a cozy corner in his home where he can meditate.
There's a chemist around the corner.
words.defineEn: a side or a section of an area, typically of a larger space or location
words.defineVi: một bên hoặc một phần của một khu vực, thường là một không gian hoặc vị trí lớn hơn

words.defineEn: the outer areas or parts of a city or town
words.defineVi: các khu vực bên ngoài hoặc các bộ phận của một thành phố hoặc thị trấn

examples: The coast is clear.
New York City is located on the east coast of the United States.
My brother went to see if the coast was clear, and we snuck out of our bedroom.
because by the middle of summer, the coast becomes home to big swarms of mosquitos and other biting insects!
The southern coast of the United States has a variety of different accents.
words.defineEn: the land near or next to a sea or ocean
words.defineVi: vùng đất gần hoặc bên cạnh biển hoặc đại dương

examples: Cobbled streets run down to a tiny harbor.
The new smartphone is streets ahead of its predecessor, with a larger screen and more powerful processor.
The experienced lawyer is streets ahead of her young colleagues, with a deep understanding of the law and years of courtroom experience.
The street vendor served crispy trotter bites with a tangy dipping sauce at the food market.
The protesters raised their cries for justice and equality in the streets.
words.defineEn: a public path for vehicles in a village, town, or city, usually with buildings, houses, etc. on its sides
words.defineVi: một con đường công cộng dành cho các phương tiện trong một ngôi làng, thị trấn hoặc thành phố, thường có các tòa nhà, nhà ở, v.v. ở hai bên

examples: The river took a meandering bend through the picturesque valley.
The general had to get his troops across the river.
The scientists are taking water samples from the river.
The road runs parallel to the river.
The map shows the principal towns and rivers.
words.defineEn: a natural and continuous stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, a lake, or another river
words.defineVi: một dòng nước tự nhiên và liên tục chảy trong một kênh ra biển, hồ hoặc sông khác

examples: Charity hits rock bottom in Emmerdale.
Morale within the company was at rock bottom.
The bottom line for 2014 was a pre-tax profit of £85 million.
You really are scraping the bottom of the barrel!
The company bets its bottom dollar when it spends a lot of money on advertising.
words.defineEn: the lowest part or point of something
words.defineVi: phần thấp nhất hoặc điểm của một cái gì đó

examples: A path led down the hill.
The village was set among olive groves on a hill.
They were driven to an unknown place in the hills.
The truck's engine roared as it climbed the steep hill.
An engineer suggested driving a tunnel through the Judean hills.
words.defineEn: a naturally raised area of land that is higher than the land around it, but smaller than a mountain
words.defineVi: một vùng đất được nâng lên tự nhiên cao hơn vùng đất xung quanh nó, nhưng nhỏ hơn một ngọn núi

examples: The struggle ended indecisively.
The surfaced road ends at the farm.
Grab the end of the rope.’
The play has too many loose ends.
All good things come to an end.
words.defineEn: he point at which something stops or ceases to exist
words.defineVi: ông chỉ ra rằng một cái gì đó dừng lại hoặc không còn tồn tại

examples: I lost track of the time.
They kept track of their mileage.
The road follows the track of the railway line.
The track led us through a wood.
Seeing flames behind a dune during one of her walks, the female narrator stops in her tracks.
words.defineEn: a road or path that is rough and usually made by animals or people repeatedly walking there
words.defineVi: một con đường hoặc lối đi gồ ghề và thường do động vật hoặc người đi bộ nhiều lần ở đó

examples: To hear both sides of the argument.
His arms dropped limply to his sides.
The manager played his strongest side of the season.
On the credit side, the restaurant offers a wide range of choices.
The restaurant served their fish and chips with a side of brown sauce.
words.defineEn: the right or left half of an object, place, or surface
words.defineVi: nửa bên phải hoặc bên trái của một đối tượng, địa điểm hoặc bề mặt

examples: The road follows the track of the railway line.
The road runs parallel to the river.
The road continues through the village of Knightwick.
The road continues for three miles.
The road led away from the house directly to the lake.
words.defineEn: a hard wide way, open to cars, buses, etc. to travel along
words.defineVi: một con đường rộng lớn, dành cho ô tô, xe buýt, v.v. đi dọc theo

examples: Because of the proposed merger, the company is standing at the crossroads.
After earning my degree, I'm at a crossroads.
This young man was at a crossroads in his life.
Sort of the party itself is at a crossroads.
We are at a crossroads.
words.defineEn: the place where a road is crossed by another
words.defineVi: nơi mà một con đường bị cắt ngang bởi một con đường khác
